quiz.text: Why was the World Bank established?
options: To promote the International Trade
To reconstruct the economies damaged during the Second World War
To improve the adverse Balance of Payment situation of the nonmember countries
A and B only
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements about the World Bank is incorrect?
options: It was formerly known as the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development
The World Bank consists of five institutions.
The World Bank was created in 1944 by the Bretton Woods Conference.
It started operating in 1945.
All of the above

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding Special Drawing Rights (SDR):
  1. SDRs are the reserve currency units of the IMF.
  2. The value of one SDR is based on the currency values of the US dollar, Euro, Japanese yen, British pound, and Renminbi.
  3. SDR basket is reviewed every five years so as to reflect the current status of currencies.
  4. SDR is also the official currency of the IMF and can be traded in the forex market.
Choose the correct statements using the codes given below
options: 1 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3 only
2, 3 and 4 only
1, 3 and 4 only
1 and 2 only

quiz.text: Which among the following institutions is NOT a part of the World Bank group?
options: International Development Association (IDA)
International Monetary Fund (IMF)
International Finance Corporation (IFC)
Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA)
International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes

quiz.text: Which one of the following statements is false?
options: IFC was established in July 1956
IFC encourage the growth and development of Public Sector Enterprises in member countries
IFC is an affiliate of the World Bank.
IFC encourages the growth of productive private enterprises in member countries.
IFC is headquartered in Washington, D.C. in the United States.

quiz.text: Which of the following is not the function of the World Bank?
options: To provide long term loan to the member countries
To provide loan to private investors belonging to member countries on its own guarantee
To ensure exchange rate stability
To provides loan mainly for productive activities
All of the above

quiz.text: Which one of the following is not the guiding principle of the World Bank regarding its lending operations?
options: Proper assessment of the repayment prospects of loans.
Lending should be only for specific projects which are economically and technically sound and of a high priority nature.
The lending should be to enable a country to meet foreign exchange content of the project cost.
The bank does expect the borrowing country to spend the loan in a particular country.
None of the above

quiz.text: The form of assistance that members of the World Bank get is
options: Technical and economic
Political and financial
Technical and financial
Political and economic
Technical and Political

quiz.text: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) is also known as
options: EXIM Bank
World Bank
International Monetary Fund
International Bank
World Trade Organisation

quiz.text: Match the Following
options: A-2, B-1, C-4, D-3
A-1, B-2, C-4, D-3
A-2, B-1, C-3, D-4
A-1, B-2, C-3, D-4
A-4, B-2, C-1, D-3

quiz.text: Regarding the International Monetary Fund, which one of the following statements is correct?
options: It can grant loans to any country.
It can grant loans to only developed countries.
It grants loans to only member countries.
It can grant loans to the central bank of a country.
None of the above

quiz.text: In which of the following year, the Bretton Woods Agreement was signed by the delegates from 44 nations which led to the establishment of IMF
options: 1945
1952
1954
1957
1944

quiz.text: After US Dollar, which of the following currencies has largest weightage in determining the value of SDR?
options: Japanese Yen
Renminbi
Euro
British Pound
None of the above

quiz.text: Bretton Woods Conference resulted into the establishment of which of the following?
options: IMA and IDA
IBRD and IFC
IDA and ADB
IMF and IBRD
ICSID and MIGA

quiz.text: In which year the IMF introduced the Special Drawing Rights to its members countries?
options: 1959
1969
1979
1989
1999

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements about International Monetary Fund (IMF):
  1. It provides technical assistance and expert advice to members in need.
  2. It is involved in the surveillance of monetary policies of member nations.
  3. It directly intervenes in the monetary systems of members, if they are found to tinker with global financial stability.
Choose the correct statements using the codes given below
options: 1, 2 and 3
2 and 3 only
2 only
1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only

quiz.text: Which of the following is known as Paper Gold?
options: Japanese Yen
US Dollar
Special Drawing Rights
British Pound
None of the above

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding The International Monetary Fund (IMF).
  1. Facilitating the expansion and balanced growth of international trade is one of the aims of the IMF.
  2. India is represented by the union finance minister as the governor and the RBI governor as the alternate governor in the Board of Governors of IMF.
  3. Decision-making at the IMF reflects the relative positions of its member countries in the global economy.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
options: 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
All the above
1 and 2 only

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the World Bank group.
  1. To become a member of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD), a country must first join the International Monetary Fund (IMF).
  2. Membership in International Development Association (IDA), the International Finance Corporation (IFC), and the Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA) are also conditional on membership in IBRD.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
options: 1 only
2 only
Both 1 and 2
Neither 1 nor 2
Any of the above

quiz.text:
Extended Fund Facility (EFF) is the most general of the special windows through which IMF offers credit to member countries. Consider the following statements regarding EFF.
  1. The EFF was established to provide assistance to countries experiencing serious payment imbalances because of structural impediments.
  2. Assistance under EFF features a longer program and a longer repayment period.
  3. Borrowing under the EFF has no upper limit.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
options: 1 only
1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
All the above
1 and 3 only

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding World Trade Organization (WTO).
  1. WTO was established in 1995, by Uruguay rounds of negotiation.
  2. The WTO agreements cover goods, services, and intellectual property.
  3. The World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) is a specialized agency of WTO.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
options: 1 only
1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
All the above
2 and 3 Only

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding IMF
  1. All member countries of the IMF are members of the United Nations
  2. The value of Special Drawing Right (SDR) is determined by the basket of six currencies.
  3. India has the 2nd largest share in the IMF quota system among the BRICS nations.
Select the correct option
options: 2 only
2 and 3 only
3 only
None of the above
1 only

quiz.text:
In WTO terminology, subsidies in general are identified by boxes. In this regard consider the following statements.
  1. Amber box subsidies are considered to distort production and trade.
  2. Green box subsidies do not distort trade, or at most cause minimal distortion.
  3. Blue box includes subsidies that are linked to one product, but that do not increase production levels.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
All the above
1 only

quiz.text:
Compulsory licensing is when a government allows someone else to produce the patented product or process without the consent of the patent owner. Consider the following statements regarding compulsory licensing'.
  1. Agreement on Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights does not allow compulsory licensing.
  2. Compulsory license is given exclusively to licensees i.e. the patent-holder cannot produce the goods after granting a compulsory license.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
options: only 1
only 2
Both 1 and 2
Neither 1 nor 2
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which two of the following are the function of the WTO 
  1. To facilitate the implementation, administration, and operation of a trade agreement 
  2. To carry out periodic reviews of the trade policies of its member countries 
  3. To assist in the establishment of a multilateral system of payments 
  4. To promote international monetary cooperation 
Choose the correct option from the following:
options: 1 and 2
1 and 3
1 and 4
2 and 4
3 and 4

quiz.text: WTO came into existence at the conclusion of which round of GATT?
options: Singapore
Uruguay
Tokyo
Marrakesh
None of the above

quiz.text:
International Monetary Fund (IMF) seeks certain conditions when providing financial resources. Which of the following are those conditions?
  1. Austerity measures
  2. Privatisation
  3. Devaluation of currencies
  4. Trade restriction
Choose the correct answer using the codes given below
options: 1 and 2 only
2, 3 and 4 only
1, 2 and 3 only
1, 3 and 4 only
1, 3 and 4 only

quiz.text:
Consider the following Rounds of Talk:
  1. Havana Round
  2. Dillon Round
  3. Kennedy Round
  4. Uruguay Round
Above rounds of talk are associated with which of the following entities?
options: World Trade Organisation
International Monetary Fund
General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade
Latin American Free Trade Zone
World Bank

quiz.text:
Which of the following mechanisms under the WTO framework is/are considered legal and fair?
  1. Special Safeguard Mechanism
  2. Anti-dumping duties
  3. Countervailing duties
  4. Public stockholding of food
Choose the correct answer using the codes given below
options: 1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
1 only
All of the above

quiz.text:
Consider the following principles of the World Trade Organization (WTO):
  1. Most Favoured Nation: countries cannot normally discriminate between their trading partners.
  2. National Treatment: Imported and locally-produced goods should be treated equally.
Choose the correct statement/s using the codes given below
options: Only 1
Only 2
Both 1 and 2
Neither 1 nor 2
Any of the above
